page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Crawfords Farm-Is an arable farm covering 65 acres-11 acres barley- 8 acres wheat.9 acres oats,13 hay ,9 acres potatoes,1 acre turips and 14 acres grass.After the E.E.C ruling that all milk had to pasteurised Mr Crawford sold his cows as he could not afford a pasteurising machine.He now buys in milk to deliver in this area.4 people are fully employed 1 part time.The staff are Mr Crawford his father(part time) and his wife and two sons. Boghill Farm-Is linked to the college of agriculture.In addition to farming and animal investigation unit,several sections in the lower fields are devided into marked plots for reasearch into grasses.The higher slopes of Caerkettion hill are used for sheep grazing whilst lower down the fields can be ploughed.
